title: Understanding Structured References
text: Structured references are a way to refer to tables and their elements in Excel. They make formulas easier to read and maintain.

title: Components of Structured References
text: Structured references can include table names, column headings, and special rows like headers or totals.

hintAnswer: a reference which uses table names, column headings, or named or special rows
title: Identifying Structured References
text: Which of the following is a characteristic of a structured reference?
choices: a reference which uses table names, column headings, or named or special rows
a reference that does not refer back to itself/is structured
a reference that automatically makes changes to the thing it is referring to
